article:
, South Australia, an area noted for vineyards]] In general, a 'rural area' is a
geographic area that is located outside cities and towns. The Health
Resources and Services Administration of the U.S. Department of Health and Human
Services defines the word "rural" as encompassing "...all population, housing,
and territory not included within an urban area. Whatever is not urban is
considered rural."

Typical rural areas have a low population density and small settlements.
Agricultural areas are commonly rural, though so are others such as forests.
Different countries have varying definitions of "rural" for statistical and
administrative purposes.
